body_html: @aizvorski TensorFlow's 2-D separable convs are built out of normal convs and depthwise convs. The first bit already exists in 3-D. The second bit can be implemented in Python by splitting, but it's slower than a native op (this is how separable convs in 2D used to work, I think). We'd be happy to accept a native 3-D version of depthwise conv, but I don't know of plans to do it ourselves. I also be happy to give some more detail on the no-new-op version of separable conv if you want, though of course it'll be less performant than a native version.
